isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Service (1995 through 1999) - SECTION 8: TIMING GEAR TRAIN AND FRONT COVER - ENGINE GEAR TRAIN TIMING - CHECKING ENGINE GEAR TRAIN TIMING WITHOUT REMOVING FRONT COVER AND/OR ENGINE TEAR DOWN.

svcproc.title: CHECKING ENGINE GEAR TRAIN TIMING WITHOUT REMOVING FRONT COVER AND/OR ENGINE TEAR DOWN.

note.para: For testing purposes only! No. 1 intake valve setting with No. 1 piston @ TDC (compression) is 0.74 mm (0.029 in.).

svcsubproc.title: Method One - Using A Feeler Gauge

step1.para: Adjust the No. 1 intake valve with the No. 1 piston set at TDC (Top Dead Center) compression stroke to 0.74 mm (0.029 in.).

Scribe a straight line or a radial line, in a clockwise direction, 47 mm (1.850 in.) in length. Start from the vibration damper pulley notch, when facing the engine ( Figure 8.3
).
Turn the engine forward to approximately BDC (Bottom Dead Center).

Place a 0.10 mm (0.004 in.) feeler gauge between the valve lever and valve stem of the No. 1 intake valve and slowly rotate the engine forward until the feeler gauge becomes tight. This is now the point at which the No. 1 intake valve starts to open before top dead center. The scribed mark should line up with the TDC arrow, located on the front cover, or be within 0.65 mm (0.260 in.) on either side of the arrow (equals ± 3.5°).

note.para: ONE (1) TOOTH "OUT OF TIME" ON the GEAR TRAIN EQUALS APPROXIMATELY 11 DEGREE MOVEMENT (21.431 mm {27/32 in.} radial distance) OF VIBRATION DAMPER.
If the timing on the No. 1 valve is within specifications, the other valves barring extreme camshaft lobe wear or poor adjustment will also be in time.

figure.caption: Figure 8.3 Checking Engine Gear Train Timing

step1.para: Readjust the No. 1 intake valve to its proper lash, refer to Section 4, "CYLINDER HEAD AND VALVES".

If timing is found to be incorrect, removal of the engine's front cover is required to inspect punch mark and gear tooth position. Figure 8.2
depicts a properly timed assembly and number of teeth between marks.

svcsubproc.title: Method Two - Using A Dial Indicator

step1.para: Adjust the No. 1 intake valve with the No. 1 piston set at TDC (Top Dead Center) compression stroke to 0.74 mm (0.029 in.).
Position the dial indicator fixture magnetic base on the valve cover fence rail with the indicator shaft on the No. 1 intake valve rotator.
Rotate the engine approximately one full revolution either direction to a position of 360° from starting point.
The dial indicator should read 3.0 to 5.59 mm (0.115 to 0.220 in.) for proper gear train timing.
If dial indicator readings are outside the specified range, the engine's front cover must be removed and punch mark and gear tooth position adjusted as specified in Figure 8.2.
Readjust the No. 1 intake valve to its proper lash as described in Section 4, "Cylinder Head and Valves".

note.para: ENGINE GEAR TRAIN TIMING AND VALVE LASH ADJUSTMENT MUST BE PERFORMED. FOLLOWING THESE PROCEDURES TO ASSURE PROPER VALVE AND PISTON RELATIONSHIP AND PREVENT PISTONS FROM STRIKING VALVES.
